content.definition: Combined open surgical and endovascular treatment performed in a single setting to address multilevel vascular disease. Leverages strengths of both approaches: durability of bypass and minimally invasive access of endovascular. Requires hybrid operating room with fixed imaging.

indications: TASC C/D iliac disease with CFA occlusion
hybrid_room_requirements: Both surgical and endovascular equipment available

examples.fem_endarterectomy_iliac_stent: Open CFA endarterectomy provides access for retrograde iliac stent
examples.arch_debranching_TEVAR: Surgical bypass to arch vessels, followed by extensive TEVAR coverage
examples.bypass_completion_angioplasty: Bypass to popliteal + tibial angioplasty for runoff

clinical_pearls: Hybrid most valuable for multilevel disease in single session
CFA endarterectomy provides excellent retrograde access for iliac intervention
Reduces contrast and radiation compared to staged procedures
Requires coordination between surgical and endovascular teams
Growing trend with improved hybrid OR infrastructure
